problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure items do not exceed box boundaries
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        
        # Ensure positions are non-negative (already constrained by Field definitions)
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_constraints(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping conditions
                assert (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or \
                       (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x) or \
                       (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or \
                       (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)

no_overlap_constraints(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_validity(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)
full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


# Object type for an item with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

# Object type for the position (x, y) of an item within a box
Position = DSRecord({
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 100
BOX_WIDTH : int = 100
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 11, "height": 79}, {"width": 84, "height": 31}, {"width": 18, "height": 91}, {"width": 78, "height": 55}, {"width": 27, "height": 87}, {"width": 8, "height": 88}, {"width": 40, "height": 68}, {"width": 16, "height": 74}, {"width": 54, "height": 53}, {"width": 2, "height": 98}, {"width": 24, "height": 88}, {"width": 65, "height": 82}, {"width": 45, "height": 92}, {"width": 7, "height": 80}, {"width": 79, "height": 23}, {"width": 26, "height": 74}, {"width": 47, "height": 35}, {"width": 24, "height": 71}, {"width": 76, "height": 75}, {"width": 99, "height": 55}]
N_ITEMS : int = 20
nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=0, ub=20):
    max_box: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i] > max_box:
            max_box = assignments[i]
    return max_box

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure items do not exceed box boundaries
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        
        # Ensure positions are non-negative (already constrained by Field definitions)
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_constraints(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping conditions
                assert (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or \
                       (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x) or \
                       (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or \
                       (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)

no_overlap_constraints(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_validity(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.

def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(

# Call the function with appropriate parameters
items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

                assert (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or \
                       (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x) or \

full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


# Object type for an item with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

# Object type for the position (x, y) of an item within a box
Position = DSRecord({
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 100
BOX_WIDTH : int = 100
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 11, "height": 79}, {"width": 84, "height": 31}, {"width": 18, "height": 91}, {"width": 78, "height": 55}, {"width": 27, "height": 87}, {"width": 8, "height": 88}, {"width": 40, "height": 68}, {"width": 16, "height": 74}, {"width": 54, "height": 53}, {"width": 2, "height": 98}, {"width": 24, "height": 88}, {"width": 65, "height": 82}, {"width": 45, "height": 92}, {"width": 7, "height": 80}, {"width": 79, "height": 23}, {"width": 26, "height": 74}, {"width": 47, "height": 35}, {"width": 24, "height": 71}, {"width": 76, "height": 75}, {"width": 99, "height": 55}]
N_ITEMS : int = 20
nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=0, ub=20):
    max_box: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i] > max_box:
            max_box = assignments[i]
    return max_box

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

# --- constraints ---

        item: Item = items[i]
        
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT

# Call the function with appropriate parameters
items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- constraints ---

    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),

                       (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x) or \
                       (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or \
                       (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_id: int = assignments[i]
        pos: Position = positions[i]
        item: Item = items[i]
        
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT

ensure_items_fit_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- constraints ---
def ensure_no_item_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping constraints
                assert positions[i].x >= positions[j].x + items[j].width or positions[j].x >= positions[i].x + items[i].width or \
                       positions[i].y >= positions[j].y + items[j].height or positions[j].y >= positions[i].y + items[i].height

ensure_no_item_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)
full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


# Object type for an item with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

# Object type for the position (x, y) of an item within a box
Position = DSRecord({
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 100
BOX_WIDTH : int = 100
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 11, "height": 79}, {"width": 84, "height": 31}, {"width": 18, "height": 91}, {"width": 78, "height": 55}, {"width": 27, "height": 87}, {"width": 8, "height": 88}, {"width": 40, "height": 68}, {"width": 16, "height": 74}, {"width": 54, "height": 53}, {"width": 2, "height": 98}, {"width": 24, "height": 88}, {"width": 65, "height": 82}, {"width": 45, "height": 92}, {"width": 7, "height": 80}, {"width": 79, "height": 23}, {"width": 26, "height": 74}, {"width": 47, "height": 35}, {"width": 24, "height": 71}, {"width": 76, "height": 75}, {"width": 99, "height": 55}]
N_ITEMS : int = 20
nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=0, ub=20):
    max_box: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i] > max_box:
            max_box = assignments[i]
    return max_box

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---

    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),

        item: Item = items[i]
        
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.initialization: ITEMS : Annotated[list[Item], Len(20, 20)] = [ITEM1, ITEM2, ITEM3, ITEM4, ITEM5, ITEM6, ITEM7, ITEM8, ITEM9, ITEM10, ITEM11, ITEM12, ITEM13, ITEM14, ITEM15, ITEM16, ITEM17, ITEM18, ITEM19, ITEM20]

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box index
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: X and Y positions of each item within its assigned box

objective:
# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=1, ub=20):
    max_box: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_nr: int = assignments[i]
        if box_nr > max_box:
            max_box = box_nr
    return max_box

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)
constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item: Item = items[i]
        pos: Position = positions[i]
        box_nr: int = assignments[i]
        
        # Ensure items fit within the box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        
        # Ensure items do not stick out (exact fit constraint)
        # This implies that the item must be placed such that it fits entirely within the box
        # The exact fit is ensured by the above constraints plus the non-overlapping constraints (not included here)

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping constraints
                # Rectangles do not overlap if one is completely to the left, right, above, or below the other
                assert (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or \
                       (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x) or \
                       (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or \
                       (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)

no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- constraints ---
def enforce_item_box_assignment_validity(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    max_box: DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)
):
    # Each item must be assigned to exactly one box, which is inherently satisfied by the variable definition
    # Ensure that the box number assigned is within the valid range [1, max_box]
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= max_box

enforce_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments, objective)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.initialization: ITEMS : Annotated[list[Item], Len(20, 20)] = [ITEM1, ITEM2, ITEM3, ITEM4, ITEM5, ITEM6, ITEM7, ITEM8, ITEM9, ITEM10, ITEM11, ITEM12, ITEM13, ITEM14, ITEM15, ITEM16, ITEM17, ITEM18, ITEM19, ITEM20]

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box index
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: X and Y positions of each item within its assigned box

objective:
# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=1, ub=20):
    max_box: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_nr: int = assignments[i]
        if box_nr > max_box:
            max_box = box_nr
    return max_box

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)
constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = positions[i].x
        pos_y: int = positions[i].y
        
        # Item must fit within the box dimensions
        assert pos_x + item_width <= box_width
        assert pos_y + item_height <= box_height
        assert pos_x >= 0
        assert pos_y >= 0

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position),
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Assert that the rectangles do not overlap
                assert (positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x) or \
                       (positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x) or \
                       (positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y) or \
                       (positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y)

no_overlap(x_y_positions, ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_consistency(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
):
    # Ensure every item is assigned to exactly one box and has a valid position
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Box assignment must be within valid range
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20
        
        # Position coordinates must be non-negative
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0

ensure_item_assignment_consistency(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.initialization: ITEMS : Annotated[list[Item], Len(20, 20)] = [ITEM1, ITEM2, ITEM3, ITEM4, ITEM5, ITEM6, ITEM7, ITEM8, ITEM9, ITEM10, ITEM11, ITEM12, ITEM13, ITEM14, ITEM15, ITEM16, ITEM17, ITEM18, ITEM19, ITEM20]

Assignment of each item to a box index
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

objective:
# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box_index: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        box_index: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        if box_index > max_box_index:
            max_box_index = box_index
    return max_box_index

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)
constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item: Item = items[i]
        pos: Position = x_y_positions[i]
        box_index: int = item_box_assignments[i]

        # Ensure item fits within box dimensions
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT

        # Ensure item does not stick out of the box (exact fit requirement)
        # This implies that the sum of widths/heights of items in a box should equal BOX_WIDTH/HEIGHT
        # However, since exact fit is required, we need to check that no space remains unused
        # We'll model this by ensuring that every coordinate in the box is covered by some item
        # But this is computationally expensive; instead, we'll enforce that the area of items equals the box area
        # This is done implicitly by requiring that all positions and sizes are valid and non-overlapping
        # The exact fit constraint is modeled through non-overlap and boundary checks
        
items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_constraints(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if item_box_assignments[i] == item_box_assignments[j]:
                # Check if rectangles overlap
                # They do NOT overlap if one is completely to the left, right, above, or below the other
                assert (
                    (x_y_positions[i].x + items[i].width <= x_y_positions[j].x) or
                    (x_y_positions[j].x + items[j].width <= x_y_positions[i].x) or
                    (x_y_positions[i].y + items[i].height <= x_y_positions[j].y) or
                    (x_y_positions[j].y + items[j].height <= x_y_positions[i].y)
                )

no_overlap_constraints(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_validity(
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)
):
    # Each item must be assigned to exactly one box (already ensured by domain of item_box_assignments)
    # We enforce that the box index does not exceed the number of used boxes
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert item_box_assignments[i] <= nr_used_boxes

ensure_item_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments, nr_used_boxes)

    The result and expected output is:

objective:
# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box_index: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_box(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item: Item = items[i]
        pos: Position = x_y_positions[i]
        # Ensure item fits within the box boundaries
        assert pos.x + item.width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert pos.y + item.height <= BOX_HEIGHT

fit_items_in_box(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check for overlap if both items are in the same box
            if item_box_assignments[i] == item_box_assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlapping conditions
                # Either i is to the left of j
                # Or i is to the right of j
                # Or i is above j
                # Or i is below j
                assert (x_y_positions[i].x + items[i].width <= x_y_positions[j].x or
                        x_y_positions[j].x + items[j].width <= x_y_positions[i].x or
                        x_y_positions[i].y + items[i].height <= x_y_positions[j].y or
                        x_y_positions[j].y + items[j].height <= x_y_positions[i].y)

no_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_validity(
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    # Each item must be assigned to exactly one box (already ensured by domain of item_box_assignments)
    # This constraint is implicitly satisfied by the variable definition
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert item_box_assignments[i] >= 1
        assert item_box_assignments[i] <= 20

ensure_item_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:

    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used to pack all items, minimized as objective
Assignment of each item to a box
X and Y positions of each item within its assigned box

objective:
# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(itemplacements: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)):
    # Calculate the maximum box ID used among all items
    max_box_id: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20) = 0
    for i in range(1, 21):
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id >= 0
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id <= 20
        if itemplacements[i].box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = itemplacements[i].box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20) = objective
minimize(objective)
constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# No auxiliary variables needed beyond what's already defined
# --- constraints ---
def place_items_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    itemplacements: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)
):
    # Ensure item placements are within box dimensions
    for i in range(1, 21):
        # Check that item fits within box
        assert itemplacements[i].x >= 0
        assert itemplacements[i].y >= 0
        assert itemplacements[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert itemplacements[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Ensure box_id is valid
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id >= 1
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id <= 1000

place_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

# Ensure all fields of item_box_assignments and x_y_positions are equal
# Since they represent the same data, we enforce this equality
for i in range(1, 21):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# No auxiliary variables needed beyond what's already defined
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_no_overlap_and_valid_placement(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    itemplacements: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)
):
    # Ensure item placements are within box dimensions
    for i in range(1, 21):
        # Check that item fits within box
        assert itemplacements[i].x >= 0
        assert itemplacements[i].y >= 0
        assert itemplacements[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert itemplacements[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Ensure box_id is valid
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id >= 1
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id <= 1000
        
        # Ensure no overlapping items in same box
        for j in range(1, 21):
            if i != j and itemplacements[i].box_id == itemplacements[j].box_id:
                # Check for overlap
                assert not (
                    (itemplacements[i].x < itemplacements[j].x + items[j].width) and
                    (itemplacements[i].x + items[i].width > itemplacements[j].x) and
                    (itemplacements[i].y < itemplacements[j].y + items[j].height) and
                    (itemplacements[i].y + items[i].height > itemplacements[j].y)
                )

ensure_no_overlap_and_valid_placement(ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

# Ensure all fields of item_box_assignments and x_y_positions are equal
for i in range(1, 21):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# No auxiliary variables needed
# --- constraints ---
def validate_item_placement_and_assignment(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    itemplacements: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)
):
    # Ensure item placements are within box dimensions and box_id is valid
    for i in range(1, 21):
        # Check that item fits within box
        assert itemplacements[i].x >= 0
        assert itemplacements[i].y >= 0
        assert itemplacements[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert itemplacements[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Ensure box_id is valid
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id >= 1
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id <= 1000
        
        # Ensure no overlapping items in same box
        for j in range(1, 21):
            if i != j and itemplacements[i].box_id == itemplacements[j].box_id:
                # Check for overlap
                assert not (
                    (itemplacements[i].x < itemplacements[j].x + items[j].width) and
                    (itemplacements[i].x + items[i].width > itemplacements[j].x) and
                    (itemplacements[i].y < itemplacements[j].y + items[j].height) and
                    (itemplacements[i].y + items[i].height > itemplacements[j].y)
                )
    
    # Ensure all fields of item_box_assignments and x_y_positions are equal
    for i in range(1, 21):
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
        assert itemplacements[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
        assert itemplacements[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

validate_item_placement_and_assignment(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)
full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


# Object type for an item with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

# Object type for box assignment and positioning of an item
ItemPlacement = DSRecord({
    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=1000),  # Assuming max 1000 boxes
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 100
BOX_WIDTH : int = 100
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [
    {"width": 11, "height": 79},
    {"width": 84, "height": 31},
    {"width": 18, "height": 91},
    {"width": 78, "height": 55},
    {"width": 27, "height": 87},
    {"width": 8, "height": 88},
    {"width": 40, "height": 68},
    {"width": 16, "height": 74},
    {"width": 54, "height": 53},
    {"width": 2, "height": 98},
    {"width": 24, "height": 88},
    {"width": 65, "height": 82},
    {"width": 45, "height": 92},
    {"width": 7, "height": 80},
    {"width": 79, "height": 23},
    {"width": 26, "height": 74},
    {"width": 47, "height": 35},
    {"width": 24, "height": 71},
    {"width": 76, "height": 75},
    {"width": 99, "height": 55}
]
N_ITEMS : int = 20
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=1, ub=1000)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)
x_y_positions : DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(itemplacements: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)):
    # Calculate the maximum box ID used among all items
    max_box_id: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20) = 0
    for i in range(1, 21):
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id >= 0
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id <= 20
        if itemplacements[i].box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = itemplacements[i].box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20) = objective
minimize(objective)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# No auxiliary variables needed beyond what's already defined
# --- constraints ---
def place_items_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    itemplacements: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)
):
    # Ensure item placements are within box dimensions
    for i in range(1, 21):
        # Check that item fits within box
        assert itemplacements[i].x >= 0
        assert itemplacements[i].y >= 0
        assert itemplacements[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert itemplacements[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Ensure box_id is valid
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id >= 1
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id <= 1000

place_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

# Ensure all fields of item_box_assignments and x_y_positions are equal
# Since they represent the same data, we enforce this equality
for i in range(1, 21):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# No auxiliary variables needed beyond what's already defined
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_no_overlap_and_valid_placement(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    itemplacements: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)
):
    # Ensure item placements are within box dimensions
    for i in range(1, 21):
        # Check that item fits within box
        assert itemplacements[i].x >= 0
        assert itemplacements[i].y >= 0
        assert itemplacements[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert itemplacements[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Ensure box_id is valid
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id >= 1
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id <= 1000
        
        # Ensure no overlapping items in same box
        for j in range(1, 21):
            if i != j and itemplacements[i].box_id == itemplacements[j].box_id:
                # Check for overlap
                assert not (
                    (itemplacements[i].x < itemplacements[j].x + items[j].width) and
                    (itemplacements[i].x + items[i].width > itemplacements[j].x) and
                    (itemplacements[i].y < itemplacements[j].y + items[j].height) and
                    (itemplacements[i].y + items[i].height > itemplacements[j].y)
                )

ensure_no_overlap_and_valid_placement(ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

# Ensure all fields of item_box_assignments and x_y_positions are equal
for i in range(1, 21):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# No auxiliary variables needed
# --- constraints ---
def validate_item_placement_and_assignment(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    itemplacements: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement),
    x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=ItemPlacement)
):
    # Ensure item placements are within box dimensions and box_id is valid
    for i in range(1, 21):
        # Check that item fits within box
        assert itemplacements[i].x >= 0
        assert itemplacements[i].y >= 0
        assert itemplacements[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert itemplacements[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Ensure box_id is valid
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id >= 1
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id <= 1000
        
        # Ensure no overlapping items in same box
        for j in range(1, 21):
            if i != j and itemplacements[i].box_id == itemplacements[j].box_id:
                # Check for overlap
                assert not (
                    (itemplacements[i].x < itemplacements[j].x + items[j].width) and
                    (itemplacements[i].x + items[i].width > itemplacements[j].x) and
                    (itemplacements[i].y < itemplacements[j].y + items[j].height) and
                    (itemplacements[i].y + items[i].height > itemplacements[j].y)
                )
    
    # Ensure all fields of item_box_assignments and x_y_positions are equal
    for i in range(1, 21):
        assert itemplacements[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
        assert itemplacements[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
        assert itemplacements[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

validate_item_placement_and_assignment(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)
